goal.ch: Algebraic number theory is a foundational course for modern number theory research. The primary goal of this course is to prepare graduate students for conducting research in number theory. We will use Serge Lang‘s book, a long-standing authority in this field, to introduce students to the essential terminology in modern number theory. A secondary aim of this course is to provide training in mathematical presentations. Throughout the semester, you will be required to give multiple presentations at the blackboard.
goal.en: Algebraic number theory is a foundational course for modern number theory research. The primary goal of this course is to prepare graduate students for conducting research in number theory. We will use Serge Lang‘s book, a long-standing authority in this field, to introduce students to the essential terminology in modern number theory. A secondary aim of this course is to provide training in mathematical presentations. Throughout the semester, you will be required to give multiple presentations at the blackboard.

outline.ch: Serge Lang‘s first five chapters, and ABC conjecture from any other source.
outline.en: Serge Lang‘s first five chapters, and ABC conjecture from any other source.
